Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Nalbuphine for Alleviating Catheter-Related Bladder Discomfort in Male Patients Undergoing Ureteroscopic Lithotripsy

Participants.evidence: male patients who underwent URL under general anesthesia at Jiaxing University Affiliated Hospital

Intervention.evidence: Patients were categorized into four groups based on nalbuphine dosage: 0.025, 0.05, 0.075, and 0.10 mg/kg.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the median effective dose (ED50) and effective dose 95% (ED95) of nalbuphine for alleviating moderate-severe CRBD.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the CRBD score measured 5 minutes after laryngeal mask removal.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The ED50 of nalbuphine was 0.03 mg/kg (95% CI: 0.013–0.046), and the ED95 was 0.108 mg/kg (95% CI: 0.085–0.188).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
